storySummary.name: house
storySummary.description: A simple black-outlined house with a triangular roof, two windows, and a door, drawn on the right side of the grass. The child has confirmed it is their house and mentioned living there with their brother and parents.

storySummary.name: person
storySummary.description: Two stick figures drawn on the grass: one with a smiling face (the brother) throwing rocks, and one with a sad face (the child) being targeted, indicating a moment of conflict or bullying between siblings. The child has not told anyone, including their parents, about the incident but is now feeling supported and ready to talk to them.

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: This story happened to me a few days ago.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: What happened in your story? Can you tell me more about it?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: What do you want to draw next in your story? Is there someone or something you’d like to add?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: What’s happening on the grass? Do you want to draw a person or something else there?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: Who lives in the house? Is it your house or someone else’s?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: This is my house.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: What do you like most about your house? Is there someone you live with there?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: special about my house. It's just a normal house. I'm living there with my brother and my parents.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: What do you like to do with your brother and parents at home? Do you have a favorite activity together?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: Why is one person smiling and the other sad? Can you tell me what’s happening with them?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: Why is the sad person upset? Did something happen between you and your brother?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Yeah, so the person on the right is me, and the person on the left which looks happy  is my brother.  And last time when we were playing together, he started to throw rocks at me on my face.  And it made me very sad.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: That sounds really upsetting. Did you tell your parents about what happened? How did they react?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: No, I didn't tell anything to anyone. I don't know how I should tell that to my parents.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: It’s okay to feel unsure, but your parents care about you. Would you like me to help you think of a way to tell them? You’re not alone in this.

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Yes please, could you give me a recommendation on how I should tell that to my parents?

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: You could say something like, “Mom and Dad, I need to tell you something that made me really sad.” Then you can show them your drawing and explain what happened. Would you like to practice saying it together?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: That's okay. I think you already helped me a lot. Thank you. I'm correct to stop to draw  and I will try to talk to my parents. Thanks a lot. Goodbye.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: You’re so brave for sharing this, and I’m proud of you for wanting to talk to your parents. Remember, I’m always here if you need to talk again. Take care, and I’m rooting for you! 💛

storySummary.name: text
storySummary.description: The drawing contains two words written in different colors: 'DANEMARK' in red and 'SWEDEN' in blue.

storySummary.name: boat
storySummary.description: A simple brown boat with a yellow sail is drawn, representing Viking boats the child learned about in museums. The child mentioned real Viking boats were seen but were not in good condition.

storySummary.name: fireworks
storySummary.description: The child described seeing colorful fireworks in Stockholm, Sweden, during New Year’s Eve, including purple, orange, red, and blue. The drawing now includes yellow fireworks with purple text '2026 NEW YEAR' nearby.

storySummary.name: person
storySummary.description: The child is sharing a personal story about their holiday travels, including Viking museums and New Year’s celebrations.

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: What do these words mean to you? Are you drawing a map or telling a story about these places?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: I'm going to tell you about my holidays, it's more specifically my Christmas break and  I went to Denmark and Sweden.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: That sounds like a fun trip! What was your favorite thing you did in Denmark or Sweden?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: Did you take a boat ride during your trip? What was it like?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: I didn't take the boats, but in Denmark and Sweden there used to be a lot of  Vikings and so I could visit some museums about Vikings and apparently they  had very good boats at the time. They used to be the best boats.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: That’s so cool! Did you see any real Viking boats in the museums? Which part of the museum did you like the most?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: I did see real Viking boats in the museum, but most of them were quite that they were not  in a very good shape anymore.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: It’s sad the boats weren’t in great shape—did you like seeing the old parts of them anyway? What else did you see in the museum?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: When I was in Sweden in Stockholm, I was there during the New Year's Eve  and I could also see the fireworks. That was quite cool.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: Wow, fireworks on New Year’s Eve must’ve been amazing! What colors did you see in the sky? Did you watch them with your family?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: There are works of many different colors, purple, orange, red, blue, that was super cool.

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: Those colors sound so magical! Did you take a picture of the fireworks? What was your favorite color?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: Drawing sent

transcript.name: VLM
transcript.description: You drew ‘2026 NEW YEAR’—are you already excited for the next New Year? What do you hope to do then?

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: This is a badminton course. I have just seen a professional match between two badminton.

transcript.name: VLM

transcript.name: User
transcript.description: No, no, I told you, it wasn't me, it was too badminton professional players.

transcript.description: A little bit sad, but I think that was okay.  But the French player looked very frustrated.  Do you know why?

transcript.description: Sometimes players get frustrated when they try their best but still lose. Do you think the French player tried really hard?

transcript.description: It’s okay to make mistakes — even pros do! Did you ever feel frustrated like that when you tried something hard?
